jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

As an Institutional Program Business Manager IV, you will be a member of the Program Business Management Division (PBMD), reporting administratively to the Manager of Office 2502, Cost Management Implementation Office (CMIO).

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the Manager of Office 2502 to achieve Division 25’s business goals, using the Institution’s business framework and processes.

  • Guide flight projects through planning for EVM baseline and implementing EVM processes in compliance with JPL EVM System Description, external requirements, and other local command media.

  • Assist flight projects in initial EVM monthly analysis and reporting.

  • Prepare projects for internal and external surveillances and IBRs, incorporating lessons learned from previous reviews.

  • Participate in negotiations of EVM-related results with JPL subcontractors.

  • Assist flight projects’ Business Managers in detailing project-specific practices in Project Business Plans.

  • Participate in Earned Value Management (EVM) surveillance (compliance) reviews of JPL projects with minimal direction.

  • Act as an interface between the flight projects and the internal surveillance team in interpreting, explaining, and addressing EVM data anomalies.

  • Analyze project EVM cost and schedule data to identify non-compliances and discrepancies between projects’ implementation of EVM and requirements such as those described in the JPL EVM System Description and the EIA-748 EVM standard.

  • Perform ad hoc special projects, analyses, and reviews of Division policies and processes related to EVM and related project support and training topics.

  • Lead EVM and IBR training for Control Account Managers and other project business team members. Modify/develop EVM and IBR training materials as needed.

  • Act as a CMIO principal Point of Contact (POC) to projects and provide oversight over these activities:

    • Communicate key EVM matters to appropriate programmatic and line directorates, including institutional leadership

    • Provide EVM compliance work with business contacts within JPL, NASA HQ, and other organizations

    • Develop and maintain effective working relationships across the JPL business community

  • Promote and foster best business practices in accordance with established Institutional processes and procedures and in accordance with the Prime Contract

    • Develop and implement business processes and products as the need arises by PBMD and the Institution

    • Promote employee awareness of best business practices and standards

    • Understand performing Center command media and any impact to JPL project controls and EVM processes

    • Contribute to, and actively support, long-range institutional initiatives, including Enterprise 2.0

  • Foster and model JPL’s Leadership Capabilities

Qualifications

  • Typically requires a Bachelor degree in Business Administration or similar discipline with a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Master’s degree in similar discipline with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years related experience.

  • Practical expertise in executing EVM projects from planning through implementation, training project staff in EVM concepts and policies, supporting projects through audits and IBRs.

  • Significant experience in analyzing large, sophisticated data sets, interpreting results, and developing recommendations

  • Breadth of experience in handling and implementing cost and schedule planning, forecasting, analysis, earned value performance measurement, assessment and reporting, project controls, cost estimation & pricing, contracts, subcontracts, and procurements.

  • Demonstrated ability to meet constantly evolving project needs and manage competing priorities.

  • Ability to maintain an objective perspective in assessment and communication of performance.

  • Proven leadership skills and demonstrated ability to develop, empower, mentor, and maintain a high performing team.

  • Significant experience providing management, direction, and expertise to activities of a multifunctional organization through managers and/or staff positions that have responsibility for results.

  • Effective communication skills in verbal, written, and presentation forms.

  • Demonstrated ability to influence sponsors, partners, subcontractors, and peers in a large project environment.

  • Ability to travel up to 10% based on business requirements.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Detailed knowledge of EVM as defined by the 32 Guidelines of the EIA-748 standard, and familiarity with interpreting the Guidelines in terms of EVM compliance

  • Hands-on experience with sophisticated EVM tools (e.g., Cobra, Empower, MS Project, and similar applications), processes, and techniques

  • Sophisticated knowledge of Excel and MS Office applications

  • Detailed knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, applicable prime contract requirements, NASA procedural requirements, and government regulations across a range of applications.

  • Sustained successful demonstration of expertise, ability, and authority in performing in a business leadership role on a sophisticated technical development.

  • Experience with, organizational change management, process definition, and process improvement

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
